Managed double-digit growth for Google Ventures-backed startup valued at $1B+ and acquired in 2017 for $800M. *Produced $1.6m savings and improved disaster recovery through efficient systems design. *Played key role building private company from $529M to successful 2011 IPO, later sold to Oracle for $1.5B. Played pivotal role in building company from $150M to successful IPO, and from startup to worldwide data center deployments.

prospects.name: Jeff Jonas
prospects.title: Founder & CEO
prospects.summary:
Jeff Jonas, founder and CEO of Senzing, is a data scientist and creator of Entity Resolution systems. For more than three decades, he has been at the forefront of solving complex big data problems for companies and governments. National Geographic recognized him as the Wizard of Big Data.  

Jonas sold his last company to IBM in 2005. Prior to founding Senzing, Jonas served as an IBM Fellow and Chief Scientist of Context Computing at IBM. He led a team focused on creating next-generation AI for Entity Resolution technology, code-named G2. At IBM G2 was deployed in many innovative ways, including modernizing U.S. voter registration through a joint effort with Pew Charitable Trust and helping the Singaporean government build a maritime domain awareness system to better protect the Malacca Straits. In 2016, Jonas founded Senzing, based on a one-of-a-kind IBM spinout of the G2 technology and team.

He regularly meets with government leaders, industry executives and think tanks around the globe about innovation, national security and privacy. Jonas serves on the boards of the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF) and the Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC), and the advisory board of the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF). He is a Senior Associate at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) and a Distinguished Engineer of Information Systems (adjunct) at Singapore Management University (SMU).

Jonas was awarded an honorary Ph.D. in Science in 2015 from Claremont Graduate University and is the author or co-author of 14 patents. His work has been featured in documentaries airing on networks such as the Discovery Channel, and he has been the subject of prominent chapters in books such as No Place to Hide, Safe: The Race to Protect Ourselves in a Newly Dangerous World, The Numerati and The Watchers: The Rise of America‚Äôs Surveillance State.
prospects.headline: Founder & CEO

prospects.name: Vladimir Ingerman
prospects.title: Founder and CEO @ AMROS Corporation | Geoscience Solutions Expert
prospects.summary:
Since 1994 Amros Corporation has been providing innovative geoscience solutions to help operators optimize the development of both conventional and unconventional reservoirs around the world.

In 2013, we introduced Shale Vision technology that separates bad and good zones in shale fields and optimizes the placement of horizontal wells. Developing only sweet spots allows operators to avoid drilling bad wells and focus on developing the highest producing wells with the potential for triple in production and recovery efficiency. This is a clean technology; an operator can save production and at the same time, pump much less water, proppants, and various chemicals under the ground.

Frac Less ‚Äì Produce More. 

More details in a 6-minute video https://youtu.be/gbKxCEsZ9_c

The technology could be easily tested using vertical wells with standard open-hole log data. A pilot project for these areas will identify reserves previously missed. We will generate locations of sweet spots, the best entry points and trajectories for horizontal wells. After this operator will have more confidence to use Shale Vision for developing new areas.

Shale Vision technology received five Awards at international technology events during 2015 ‚Äì 2021:

‚Ä¢	2021 Go Global Awards for a Frontrunner Award Professional Services in the category Energy. 
‚Ä¢	Finalist 2019 InnoSTARS Competition hosted by the US - China Innovation and Investment Summit. 
‚Ä¢	The Global Petroleum Show 2018 Award Winner in the category Innovations in Technologies. 
‚Ä¢	Finalist in the category New Horizons Idea in The World Oil Awards 2016.
‚Ä¢	Rice Alliance Energy 2015 Award Winner in the category Energy and Clean Technology.

Dr. Ingerman received a Doctor of Technical Science, as well as a Ph.D. in oil field development, and a Master of Science in geophysical methods. He has 55 professional publications, including two books. He has advised Schlumberger, Halliburton, Amoco, Shell, El Paso, and others in the United States. Internationally, he has advised all major Russian oil companies, most major oil firms in South America, Maersk Oil in Denmark, and ONGC in India. 

He has visited 74 countries, swam in 55 seas and oceans, and participated in a yacht trip around the world.
prospects.headline: Founder and CEO @ AMROS Corporation | Geoscience Solutions Expert

prospects.summary:
I am a London IT thought leader, entrepreneur and cybersecurity expert. I am an Entrepreneur's Organisation London member and was nominated for the prestigious UKTech50 award in 2022. 
 
I hold several IT qualifications including various Microsoft, Checkpoint and VMware certifications. Combined with my 20-plus years of experience in IT, and management qualifications from the London School of Business & Finance and Cranfield School of Management, I appreciate that IT drives growth but also has security risks.
 
In 2006, I founded Zhero, a London-headquartered end-to-end cybersecurity and IT support company for SMEs. Zhero is a Microsoft Gold partner providing bespoke risk mitigation, cybersecurity, cloud, IT support, consultancy, and professional services to the medical, finance, legal, insurance, and architecture sectors and others. Zhero has worked with brilliant minds and institutions such as WeWork, Giorgio Armani, Energy UK, the Federation of Master Builders, City, University of London and Dimension Data.
 
In November 2023, I published my latest Amazon best-seller, You Don‚Äôt Need a ¬£1 Million Cybersecurity Budget. The book shows how SMEs can affordably enhance cybersecurity resilience and cyber hygiene. It peaked at number one in the UK and the US, making me an international best-selling author. I have previously co-authored two best-selling IT books, ‚ÄòAdapt and Overcome‚Äô and ‚ÄòCybersecurity NOW‚Äô, available on Amazon. These are essential reads for navigating the worlds of cybersecurity, remote working, and the digitised workplace. My insights have also been featured in The Economist, UK Computer Weekly and other prominent publications.

In January 2024, I co-founded Cyber London and others and am also a director. prospects.name: Addison Morris
prospects.title: Founder & CEO at Women's Cannabis Chamber of Commerce
prospects.summary:
I am a serial entrepreneur with more than 50 years of experience developing, launching, and marketing businesses. Coming from a long line of entrepreneurs, I have always focused on identifying market niches, anticipating economic trends, and adapting to evolving consumer demands.

Over the past five decades, I have launched seven successful businesses, gained valuable lessons from one that failed, and strategically chose not to pursue two others after recognizing their lack of viability.
Before entering the cannabis industry, I founded Panache Press, a social media marketing and business development company. There, I worked with 28 entrepreneurs, providing strategic planning, market research, financing guidance, and marketing strategies that helped them successfully launch and grow their businesses.

As an equal rights activist in Colorado, I became deeply involved in the movement to legalize adult-use cannabis. Recognizing the enormous opportunities legalization would create, I rebranded Panache Press as Sweet Jane Marketing, one of the first agencies dedicated to the cannabis industry.

In 2016, I launched the Women‚Äôs Cannabis Chamber of Commerce (WCCC) to provide entrepreneurs with essential business, cannabis, and marketing education. Since its founding, the Chamber has continued to evolve, expanding membership benefits to meet the needs of a rapidly changing industry.

 üëâ Learn more: womenscannabischamberofcommerce.com/membership

With over 15 years of experience developing and teaching cannabis business and marketing strategies, I am now returning to my roots‚Äîbusiness development and strategic planning‚Äîworking directly with entrepreneurs to build sustainable, successful companies in this rapidly evolving industry.
Through the Women‚Äôs Cannabis Chamber of Commerce, I have cultivated relationships with accomplished cannabis business owners across every sector. Their expertise and insights enhance our ability to design comprehensive Business Development Plans tailored to each client‚Äôs vision and goals.

Our Business Development Plans encompass:

Business Strategy

Market Research

Competitive Analysis

Marketing Strategy

Brand Book

Sales Strategy

Financial Projections

Additionally, we offer Operational Plans (SOPs) and Compliance Plans as needed.

Addison Morris & Co. officially launches January 1, 2026.

For more information contact: addison@womenscannabischamberofcommerce.com
prospects.headline: Founder & CEO at Women's Cannabis Chamber of Commerce

prospects.name: Jeff Jonas
prospects.title: Founder & CEO
prospects.summary:
Jeff Jonas, founder and CEO of Senzing, is a data scientist and creator of Entity Resolution systems. For more than three decades, he has been at the forefront of solving complex big data problems for companies and governments. National Geographic recognized him as the Wizard of Big Data.  

Jonas sold his last company to IBM in 2005. Prior to founding Senzing, Jonas served as an IBM Fellow and Chief Scientist of Context Computing at IBM. He led a team focused on creating next-generation AI for Entity Resolution technology, code-named G2. At IBM G2 was deployed in many innovative ways, including modernizing U.S. voter registration through a joint effort with Pew Charitable Trust and helping the Singaporean government build a maritime domain awareness system to better protect the Malacca Straits. In 2016, Jonas founded Senzing, based on a one-of-a-kind IBM spinout of the G2 technology and team.

He regularly meets with government leaders, industry executives and think tanks around the globe about innovation, national security and privacy. Jonas serves on the boards of the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF) and the Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC), and the advisory board of the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF). He is a Senior Associate at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) and a Distinguished Engineer of Information Systems (adjunct) at Singapore Management University (SMU).

Jonas was awarded an honorary Ph.D. in Science in 2015 from Claremont Graduate University and is the author or co-author of 14 patents. His work has been featured in documentaries airing on networks such as the Discovery Channel, and he has been the subject of prominent chapters in books such as No Place to Hide, Safe: The Race to Protect Ourselves in a Newly Dangerous World, The Numerati and The Watchers: The Rise of America‚Äôs Surveillance State.

If your target buyers don‚Äôt see you as a trusted authority early, you‚Äôll never even get considered.

Here‚Äôs what most leaders don‚Äôt realize: 90% of buyers build their shortlist before they even begin a formal buying process. If you‚Äôre not already on that list, getting added later is nearly impossible. 

And even if you do get added, most of the deals still go to the firms who influenced the buying vision from the very beginning. That‚Äôs the painful reality many companies don‚Äôt see until it‚Äôs too late.

If your firm is invisible to buyers before they start, you won‚Äôt even be considered. 

The leaders who show up early‚Äîsharing insights, shaping conversations, and establishing themselves as credible authorities‚Äîthey're the ones who make the list.

That‚Äôs why your individual executive voices matter. And that's why your presence on LinkedIn matters.

A faceless brand can‚Äôt build the same visibility or trust. People want to follow people, not just a logo.

The executives who understand this are seeing powerful results.

Gal Aga‚Äôs LinkedIn presence now drives 65% of his company‚Äôs leads.
Alina Vandenberghe says 50% of Chili Piper‚Äôs open opportunities are influenced by her posts‚Äîmillions in revenue every quarter.

Even leaders with modest followings are landing enterprise conversations, shortening sales cycles, and giving their teams the air cover they need to close bigger deals faster.

That‚Äôs the outcome I help leaders create. Not by turning you into an influencer, but by helping you become the trusted authority buyers recognize before they ever talk to sales.

Because when your leadership team is visible to your target audience, the whole company wins.

If you‚Äôd like to explore how visibility could change the game for your business, let‚Äôs connect.

prospects.name: Vladimir Ingerman
prospects.title: Founder and CEO @ AMROS Corporation | Geoscience Solutions Expert
prospects.summary:
Since 1994 Amros Corporation has been providing innovative geoscience solutions to help operators optimize the development of both conventional and unconventional reservoirs around the world.

In 2013, we introduced Shale Vision technology that separates bad and good zones in shale fields and optimizes the placement of horizontal wells. Developing only sweet spots allows operators to avoid drilling bad wells and focus on developing the highest producing wells with the potential for triple in production and recovery efficiency. This is a clean technology; an operator can save production and at the same time, pump much less water, proppants, and various chemicals under the ground.

Frac Less ‚Äì Produce More. 

More details in a 6-minute video https://youtu.be/gbKxCEsZ9_c

The technology could be easily tested using vertical wells with standard open-hole log data. A pilot project for these areas will identify reserves previously missed. We will generate locations of sweet spots, the best entry points and trajectories for horizontal wells. After this operator will have more confidence to use Shale Vision for developing new areas.

Shale Vision technology received five Awards at international technology events during 2015 ‚Äì 2021:

‚Ä¢	2021 Go Global Awards for a Frontrunner Award Professional Services in the category Energy. 
‚Ä¢	Finalist 2019 InnoSTARS Competition hosted by the US - China Innovation and Investment Summit. 
‚Ä¢	The Global Petroleum Show 2018 Award Winner in the category Innovations in Technologies. 
‚Ä¢	Finalist in the category New Horizons Idea in The World Oil Awards 2016.
‚Ä¢	Rice Alliance Energy 2015 Award Winner in the category Energy and Clean Technology.

Dr. Ingerman received a Doctor of Technical Science, as well as a Ph.D. in oil field development, and a Master of Science in geophysical methods. He has 55 professional publications, including two books. He has advised Schlumberger, Halliburton, Amoco, Shell, El Paso, and others in the United States. Internationally, he has advised all major Russian oil companies, most major oil firms in South America, Maersk Oil in Denmark, and ONGC in India. 

He has visited 74 countries, swam in 55 seas and oceans, and participated in a yacht trip around the world.
prospects.headline: Founder and CEO @ AMROS Corporation | Geoscience Solutions Expert

I am a London IT thought leader, entrepreneur and cybersecurity expert. I am an Entrepreneur's Organisation London member and was nominated for the prestigious UKTech50 award in 2022. 
 
I hold several IT qualifications including various Microsoft, Checkpoint and VMware certifications. Combined with my 20-plus years of experience in IT, and management qualifications from the London School of Business & Finance and Cranfield School of Management, I appreciate that IT drives growth but also has security risks.
 
In 2006, I founded Zhero, a London-headquartered end-to-end cybersecurity and IT support company for SMEs. Zhero is a Microsoft Gold partner providing bespoke risk mitigation, cybersecurity, cloud, IT support, consultancy, and professional services to the medical, finance, legal, insurance, and architecture sectors and others. Zhero has worked with brilliant minds and institutions such as WeWork, Giorgio Armani, Energy UK, the Federation of Master Builders, City, University of London and Dimension Data.
 
In November 2023, I published my latest Amazon best-seller, You Don‚Äôt Need a ¬£1 Million Cybersecurity Budget. The book shows how SMEs can affordably enhance cybersecurity resilience and cyber hygiene. It peaked at number one in the UK and the US, making me an international best-selling author. I have previously co-authored two best-selling IT books, ‚ÄòAdapt and Overcome‚Äô and ‚ÄòCybersecurity NOW‚Äô, available on Amazon. These are essential reads for navigating the worlds of cybersecurity, remote working, and the digitised workplace. My insights have also been featured in The Economist, UK Computer Weekly and other prominent publications.

In January 2024, I co-founded Cyber London and others and am also a director. Cyber London is recognised by the Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT) and the UK Cyber Cluster Collaboration (UKC3) as the official Cyber Cluster for London, an informal network of people and organisations who work in or have an interest in cybersecurity. 

I‚Äôve been a keynote speaker at events hosted by The Economist, N-Able, and London Market Forums (LMF). At the LMF 2023 Cyber Resilience Leaders‚Äô Summit, I shared cutting-edge cybersecurity and risk mitigation strategies with contemporary pioneers such as Gary Brailsford-Hart, Director of Information & CISO at City of London Police, and Simon Newman, CEO of the Cyber Resilience Centre for London. In collaboration with City, University of London, I have also had the privilege to represent the UK at round table events hosted by the Australian High Commission.

Mining accessible microbiomes at an industrial scale, in quality, and quantity, is real and legitimately the only way to uncover the critically important small molecule secrets of microbes and microbiomes that is leverageable to all therapeutics and life sciences.

Persistence and determination will prevail in the end & ultimately, major breakthroughs will result and benefit humanity.

prospects.name: Demetrios Salpoglou
prospects.title: CEO at Boston Pads | Technology Innovator | National Real Estate Thought Leader and Influencer | Real Estate Developer and Broker | Multi-Family Sales Specialist | Largest Real Estate Leasing Team in New England
prospects.summary:
Demetrios is currently the CEO of Boston Pads. He has over 30 years of extensive real estate and technology experience. Mr. Salpoglou owns several of the most successful and recognized real estate brands in New England including: Boardwalk Properties, Nextgen Realty, Jacob Realty, Douglas Paul Real Estate and US WOO. 

For 20 consecutive years, Boardwalk Properties, Nextgen Realty, Jacob Realty and Douglas Paul have recorded the most apartment leasing transactions in the history of New England.  As broker of record, Demetrios oversees thousands of leasing and sales transactions each year.

Demetrios develops specific technology and information services for Bostonpads.com.  He has a relentless focus on building advanced systems and products that revolutionize the real estate industry.  Innovating and time efficiency fuel his mission to build the most trusted full stack real estate ecosystem on the planet.

Mr. Salpoglou has built an impressive array of technology tools that helps tens of thousands of landlords, property managers and consumers make the best decisions in real estate.  Demetrios has built and deployed a vast network of heavily trafficked and hyper-local real estate websites, CRM applications, Admaking technologies, and social media accelerators that drive unparalleled amounts of visibility and highly qualified customers in Massachusetts.  Bostonpads is the most widely used and recognized local real estate portal in New England. 

Companies utilizing his strategic real estate services are delivered the most leads, listings and accurate data at their fingertips.  Customers and consumers utilizing their ecosystem find buying, selling and leasing opportunities in a faster and more accurate manner. Organizing, streamlining data and helping companies is a lifelong passion and helps fuels the success of the people that work with him.

Demetrios has significant experience in: Real Estate Development, Zoning and Variance Deals, Renovations, and property management.  He owns numerous investment properties throughout the United States.  Demetrios is regularly hired by companies and high net worth individuals to provide strategic real estate advice on any all matters regarding: multifamily, technology, leasing and investment property strategies.

Mr. Salpoglou is also certified teacher and highly sought-after speaker at prominent media outlets and numerous universities.  He also guest lectures at leading real estate schools in MA.
Demetrios is in the process of finishing his long awaited first book: Maximum Time Principles (MTP).
prospects.headline: CEO at Boston Pads | Technology Innovator | National Real Estate Thought Leader and Influencer | Real Estate Developer and Broker | Multi-Family Sales Specialist | Largest Real Estate Leasing Team in New England

April has held strategic roles in public relations, media production for broadcast, corporate, educational, and marketing as well as project management for most of her career. As the director of education and communications for Consolidated Credit, she generates awareness about personal finance issues and acts as their consumer affairs advocate as well as plans and produces consumer education, branding, and direct response content.  

Currently, she oversees the content and editorial direction for several personal finance consumer websites.  Cultivating brand voices through a variety of content including storytelling, graphics, and video. The team turns clunky marketing language into crisp, persuasive messaging, that brings brands to life. Crafting copy that elevates businesses' reputations to outperform competitors while boosting consumer confidence is the mission.

Her promotional educational efforts can be seen in the New York Times, Washington Post, Newsday, Consumer Reports, Forbes. US News and World Reports, Bankrate, the American City Business Journals, Money Magazine, Glamour, Cosmopolitan, among others. 

Prior to joining Consolidated Credit, she was the public relations manager for a Boston-based event firm, and previous to that, she was employed by John Hancock Financial Services, Inc. where she counseled employees on 401K and IRA accounts. prospects.name: Addison Morris
prospects.title: Founder & CEO at Women's Cannabis Chamber of Commerce
prospects.summary:
I am a serial entrepreneur with more than 50 years of experience developing, launching, and marketing businesses. Coming from a long line of entrepreneurs, I have always focused on identifying market niches, anticipating economic trends, and adapting to evolving consumer demands.

Over the past five decades, I have launched seven successful businesses, gained valuable lessons from one that failed, and strategically chose not to pursue two others after recognizing their lack of viability.
Before entering the cannabis industry, I founded Panache Press, a social media marketing and business development company. There, I worked with 28 entrepreneurs, providing strategic planning, market research, financing guidance, and marketing strategies that helped them successfully launch and grow their businesses.

As an equal rights activist in Colorado, I became deeply involved in the movement to legalize adult-use cannabis. Recognizing the enormous opportunities legalization would create, I rebranded Panache Press as Sweet Jane Marketing, one of the first agencies dedicated to the cannabis industry.

In 2016, I launched the Women‚Äôs Cannabis Chamber of Commerce (WCCC) to provide entrepreneurs with essential business, cannabis, and marketing education. Since its founding, the Chamber has continued to evolve, expanding membership benefits to meet the needs of a rapidly changing industry.

 üëâ Learn more: womenscannabischamberofcommerce.com/membership

With over 15 years of experience developing and teaching cannabis business and marketing strategies, I am now returning to my roots‚Äîbusiness development and strategic planning‚Äîworking directly with entrepreneurs to build sustainable, successful companies in this rapidly evolving industry.
Through the Women‚Äôs Cannabis Chamber of Commerce, I have cultivated relationships with accomplished cannabis business owners across every sector. Their expertise and insights enhance our ability to design comprehensive Business Development Plans tailored to each client‚Äôs vision and goals.

Our Business Development Plans encompass:

Business Strategy

Market Research

Competitive Analysis

Marketing Strategy

Brand Book

Sales Strategy

Financial Projections

Additionally, we offer Operational Plans (SOPs) and Compliance Plans as needed.

Addison Morris & Co. officially launches January 1, 2026.

For more information contact: addison@womenscannabischamberofcommerce.com
prospects.headline: Founder & CEO at Women's Cannabis Chamber of Commerce

prospects.name: Jeff Eschliman
prospects.title: Executive Coach for CEOs & Senior Leaders | Helping You Align Teams, Scale with Confidence & Win Back Your Time
prospects.summary:
Most CEOs and senior leaders are overwhelmed by misalignment.
Teams are busy‚Äîbut not always on the right things.
Firefighting replaces strategy, and growth feels harder than it should.

That‚Äôs where I come in.

I know how isolating and exhausting leadership can be‚ÄîI‚Äôve lived it.
From leading under fire in the Gulf War to guiding $500M+ corporate operations, I‚Äôve spent 30 years building leaders and teams that thrive under pressure.

Now, as an Executive Coach, I help growth-minded CEOs and leadership teams cut through complexity and scale with clarity and confidence.

Here‚Äôs how we work together:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Discover ‚Äì We uncover the leadership dynamics and challenges holding you back.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Design ‚Äì Together, we build a roadmap that aligns your team and sets measurable priorities.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Develop ‚Äì I walk alongside you with coaching, accountability, and tools that build lasting momentum.

Imagine your leadership team fully aligned‚Äîmeetings productive, accountability high, drama low.
You‚Äôre free to focus on growth and vision instead of constant firefighting.
Your business is scaling sustainably, and you feel energized about the future.

Without alignment, everything stays bottlenecked at the top.
Your best people leave, culture erodes, and growth stalls.
In short, chaos compounds when leaders delay.

If you‚Äôre ready to align your team, scale with confidence, and win back your time‚Äîlet‚Äôs talk.

üëâ Book your intro session: https://calendly.com/jeffeschliman/intro-session

#Leadership #ExecutiveCoach #RiseLeader #Heroic #StrategicGrowth #ExecutiveLeadership

prospects.title: President/CEO @ BlackRock Resources | Project Management, Construction Management, Staffing/Recruiting
prospects.summary:
For the past 25+ years I have been connecting industry leading experts in Project Management, Project Controls, Planning/Scheduling, and Cost Controls to global organizations.  I have staffed complete PMOs in the Oil/Gas, Renewable (RNG, BioGas, Wind, Solar, Hydrogen), Nuclear, Energy, Mining, Infrastructure, Construction and the Government funded (DOD, DOE, NASA, NSF, and others) industries.  I am well connected, experienced and I have the resources you need to keep your projects on schedule and in budget.

Don't hesitate to contact me.

You can reach me at: 724-941-4947 or mparker@blackrockres.com

Specialties: Project Management, Construction Management, Project Controls, Earned Value Management, Planning/Scheduling, Cost Controls/Analysis, Estimating, IBRs, CPM, IMP/IMS, Material Management, Contract Administration, Supply Chain, Document Controls, Environmental Heath and Safety (EHS)

prospects.summary:
From Marine to serial entrepreneur, I‚Äôve always been the kind of person who moves fast and embraces challenges head-on.

Right after high school, I chased my childhood dream of becoming an actor and moved to New York City. I spent a few years in Manhattan, making strides toward that goal. But on the morning of September 11th, 2001, everything changed. Witnessing the fall of the World Trade Center firsthand, I felt a deep calling to serve. That day inspired me to put my ambitions on hold and enlist in the United States Marine Corps.

I served for six years in the Marine Corps Infantry, including combat tours in Iraq and Afghanistan, where I was decorated for valor. After my honorable discharge in 2008, I returned home and started over. I used the GI Bill to pursue a degree in Business Administration, which was where my entrepreneurial journey really began.

While still in college, I started a DJ and mobile entertainment company, Island Sound (now iSound Entertainment). That led to opening a food truck, which launched me into the restaurant industry. Over the years, I‚Äôve opened several other restaurants and businesses, both independent and national franchises‚Äîmany of which I still own today.

In 2022, drawing from my years of experience as an employer, I began developing GAGE, a mobile app and platform designed to revolutionize the workforce. GAGE is the first Universal Employment Record and Recognition platform, built specifically for the shift and hourly workforce. It‚Äôs a project that‚Äôs very close to my heart and one I believe will truly shake up the industry for good.

prospects.title: Co-Founder & CEO at CreateBase | Building the first artist-powered backend for music rights | Empowering creators with non-generative AI to own, automate & thrive in the industry they love | Perplexity Campus Partner
prospects.summary:
Give value first and lead with gratitude, always.

I didn't set out to build a music rights company. I set out to fix broken systems - and none are more broken, or more important to creators, than the one that decides who gets paid and when.

I started my career in law. Worked in BigLaw, government, and tech across the U.S. and abroad. But before all that, I managed artists and saw firsthand how royalties vanished, songs went unregistered, and creators got ghosted by the very system meant to pay them.

That's when it clicked: the problem isn't legal. It's structural. It's metadata. It's the missing link between music and money. And if artists don't have a seat at that table, they don't just miss out: they disappear.

So we found some incredible people, and together, we built CreateBase. Not another "dashboard". Not another "rights portal". We're building the backend of the music industry, and making it creator-first.

Every artist has a story - we turn yours into royalties. 

https://createbase.com

prospects.name: Dirk van Velzen
prospects.title: World Changer + People Collector + Mountain Athlete
prospects.summary:
I'm passionate about criminal justice reform, especially correctional education. There‚Äôs not much you can do about most things when you‚Äôre on the inside, but you can choose how to spend your time--something you‚Äôve got plenty of. Incarceration, as strange as it sounds, offers a unique opportunity to focus on, and build, a new future. That‚Äôs exactly what I did.

I knew I needed to change my life, but learned that prisoners were precluded from the Pell Grant, due to the Violent Crime Control and Law Enforcement Act of 1994. It wasn‚Äôt until my father stepped in that I was able to enroll in the distance learning degree program at Penn State, where I earned degrees in Business Administration and Organizational Leadership.

I also discovered that a large number of my fellow prisoners wanted to pursue an education as well. They were certainly as motivated and hardworking as I was, but they lacked the resources to realize their ambitions. Inspired by their passion and moved by their struggles, I founded the PSF in 2006, whose mission is to help incarcerated students become successful members of their communities by providing college, vocational, and technical education, as well as mentoring services. Over the next eight years, I received thousands of letters, applications, and essays from incarcerated women and men from around the country, and learned how truly massive, and yet deeply personal the problem is--a population so diverse and full of potential, is left virtually ignored and unsupported.

The PSF has supported 132 Prison Scholars--to great success. Many of our scholars have obtained academic certificates, seven of our students have earned associate‚Äôs and bachelor‚Äôs degrees, and two of our Prison Scholars are positioned to earn their MBAs through distance education. Of the 84 Prison Scholars who have been released, only three have been re-arrested, giving the PSF a recidivism rate of 4%, which compares quite favorably to 68% nationally.
prospects.headline: World Changer + People Collector + Mountain Athlete

A number of news outlets including TechCrunch, Fast Company, Venture Beat, Wired, Popular Science, Aviation Week, NPR, Gigacom, Forbes, MoonandBack, engadget, The Denver Post, Le Monde and 60 Minutes have covered her work in drones, rocketry and Singularity University impact technology projects. 

Darlene received her bachelor‚Äôs degree from Stanford University, her master‚Äôs degree from Johns Hopkins University's Paul H. Nitze School for Advanced International Studies (SAIS), was a fellow with Japan-US Community Education and Exchange, is an advisor to the UN World Food Programme Innovation Accelerator, was a mentor with Google‚Äôs impact accelerator, a judge for Stanford BASES, and served on the Biden Administration‚Äôs Working Group on Cross Border Trade. She holds patents in drone technology and Authority Magazine featured her as a social impact hero.
prospects.headline: Enabling Tech Innovators to Solve the World's Biggest Challenges I Author of Your Dream Job is Here: The Impact Technology Revolution and New Jobs Saving the World | Singularity Fellow and former VP of Impact |

prospects.name: Charles Turner
prospects.title: Founder and CEO at KARE
prospects.summary:
Do You Kare? 

An innovator in the senior housing space, Charles is currently the CEO of KARE, which is the leading solution to solve the labor shortage in senior care. Prior to KARE, Charles was the President and CEO of Lifewell Senior Living and PinPoint Senior Living where he led development and operating initiatives for the companies. 

Charles has been instrumental in identifying and developing nearly a half billion dollars in Medical and Senior Housing projects including Hospitals, Medical Office Buildings and Assisted Living developments in several states throughout the Sun Belt United States.

Charles has also been Vice President of Finance, Planning and Operations for Attachmate (formerly NetIQ), a $400 Million software company, where he was responsible for financial management, strategic planning activities and real estate. Prior to Attachmate, Charles worked at BMC Software where he was responsible for internal strategic planning as well as restructuring the company‚Äôs real estate portfolio, saving the company over $30 Million per year in real estate expense from asset sales and lease restructuring. Charles also has several years experience in Big 4 consulting as well as industrial distribution management. Charles holds a B.A. in History and Politics from Wake Forest University and an M.B.A. in Finance from The University of Texas in Austin.
prospects.headline: Founder and CEO at KARE

prospects.name: Jeff Jonas
prospects.title: Founder & CEO
prospects.summary:
Jeff Jonas, founder and CEO of Senzing, is a data scientist and creator of Entity Resolution systems. For more than three decades, he has been at the forefront of solving complex big data problems for companies and governments. National Geographic recognized him as the Wizard of Big Data.  

Jonas sold his last company to IBM in 2005. Prior to founding Senzing, Jonas served as an IBM Fellow and Chief Scientist of Context Computing at IBM. He led a team focused on creating next-generation AI for Entity Resolution technology, code-named G2. At IBM G2 was deployed in many innovative ways, including modernizing U.S. voter registration through a joint effort with Pew Charitable Trust and helping the Singaporean government build a maritime domain awareness system to better protect the Malacca Straits. In 2016, Jonas founded Senzing, based on a one-of-a-kind IBM spinout of the G2 technology and team.

He regularly meets with government leaders, industry executives and think tanks around the globe about innovation, national security and privacy. Jonas serves on the boards of the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF) and the Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC), and the advisory board of the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF). He is a Senior Associate at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) and a Distinguished Engineer of Information Systems (adjunct) at Singapore Management University (SMU).

Jonas was awarded an honorary Ph.D. in Science in 2015 from Claremont Graduate University and is the author or co-author of 14 patents. His work has been featured in documentaries airing on networks such as the Discovery Channel, and he has been the subject of prominent chapters in books such as No Place to Hide, Safe: The Race to Protect Ourselves in a Newly Dangerous World, The Numerati and The Watchers: The Rise of America‚Äôs Surveillance State.
prospects.headline: Founder & CEO

prospects.name: Vladimir Ingerman
prospects.title: Founder and CEO @ AMROS Corporation | Geoscience Solutions Expert
prospects.summary:
Since 1994 Amros Corporation has been providing innovative geoscience solutions to help operators optimize the development of both conventional and unconventional reservoirs around the world.

In 2013, we introduced Shale Vision technology that separates bad and good zones in shale fields and optimizes the placement of horizontal wells. Developing only sweet spots allows operators to avoid drilling bad wells and focus on developing the highest producing wells with the potential for triple in production and recovery efficiency. This is a clean technology; an operator can save production and at the same time, pump much less water, proppants, and various chemicals under the ground.

Frac Less ‚Äì Produce More. 

More details in a 6-minute video https://youtu.be/gbKxCEsZ9_c

The technology could be easily tested using vertical wells with standard open-hole log data. A pilot project for these areas will identify reserves previously missed. We will generate locations of sweet spots, the best entry points and trajectories for horizontal wells. After this operator will have more confidence to use Shale Vision for developing new areas.

Shale Vision technology received five Awards at international technology events during 2015 ‚Äì 2021:

‚Ä¢	2021 Go Global Awards for a Frontrunner Award Professional Services in the category Energy. 
‚Ä¢	Finalist 2019 InnoSTARS Competition hosted by the US - China Innovation and Investment Summit. 
‚Ä¢	The Global Petroleum Show 2018 Award Winner in the category Innovations in Technologies. 
‚Ä¢	Finalist in the category New Horizons Idea in The World Oil Awards 2016.
‚Ä¢	Rice Alliance Energy 2015 Award Winner in the category Energy and Clean Technology.

Dr. Ingerman received a Doctor of Technical Science, as well as a Ph.D. in oil field development, and a Master of Science in geophysical methods. He has 55 professional publications, including two books. He has advised Schlumberger, Halliburton, Amoco, Shell, El Paso, and others in the United States. Internationally, he has advised all major Russian oil companies, most major oil firms in South America, Maersk Oil in Denmark, and ONGC in India. 

He has visited 74 countries, swam in 55 seas and oceans, and participated in a yacht trip around the world.
prospects.headline: Founder and CEO @ AMROS Corporation | Geoscience Solutions Expert

I am a London IT thought leader, entrepreneur and cybersecurity expert. I am an Entrepreneur's Organisation London member and was nominated for the prestigious UKTech50 award in 2022. 
 
I hold several IT qualifications including various Microsoft, Checkpoint and VMware certifications. Combined with my 20-plus years of experience in IT, and management qualifications from the London School of Business & Finance and Cranfield School of Management, I appreciate that IT drives growth but also has security risks.
 
In 2006, I founded Zhero, a London-headquartered end-to-end cybersecurity and IT support company for SMEs. Zhero is a Microsoft Gold partner providing bespoke risk mitigation, cybersecurity, cloud, IT support, consultancy, and professional services to the medical, finance, legal, insurance, and architecture sectors and others. Zhero has worked with brilliant minds and institutions such as WeWork, Giorgio Armani, Energy UK, the Federation of Master Builders, City, University of London and Dimension Data.
 
In November 2023, I published my latest Amazon best-seller, You Don‚Äôt Need a ¬£1 Million Cybersecurity Budget. The book shows how SMEs can affordably enhance cybersecurity resilience and cyber hygiene. It peaked at number one in the UK and the US, making me an international best-selling author. I have previously co-authored two best-selling IT books, ‚ÄòAdapt and Overcome‚Äô and ‚ÄòCybersecurity NOW‚Äô, available on Amazon. These are essential reads for navigating the worlds of cybersecurity, remote working, and the digitised workplace. My insights have also been featured in The Economist, UK Computer Weekly and other prominent publications.

In January 2024, I co-founded Cyber London and others and am also a director. Cyber London is recognised by the Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT) and the UK Cyber Cluster Collaboration (UKC3) as the official Cyber Cluster for London, an informal network of people and organisations who work in or have an interest in cybersecurity. 

I‚Äôve been a keynote speaker at events hosted by The Economist, N-Able, and London Market Forums (LMF). At the LMF 2023 Cyber Resilience Leaders‚Äô Summit, I shared cutting-edge cybersecurity and risk mitigation strategies with contemporary pioneers such as Gary Brailsford-Hart, Director of Information & CISO at City of London Police, and Simon Newman, CEO of the Cyber Resilience Centre for London. Persistence and determination will prevail in the end & ultimately, major breakthroughs will result and benefit humanity.

prospects.name: Alok Aggarwal
prospects.title: CEO and Chief Data Scientist at Scry AI | Author of the book, "The Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950-2050)"
prospects.summary:
Dr. Alok Aggarwal received his B. Tech. from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi in 1980 and his Ph. D. in 1984 from Johns Hopkins University in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. He worked at IBM‚Äôs T. J. Watson Research Center in New York during 1984 and 2000. During 1988-89, he took a sabbatical from IBM and to teach two courses and supervise two Ph.D. students at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). 

During 1992 and 1995, along with others, he built and sold a "Supply Chain Management Solution" for paper mills and steel mills, which was the first commercial Artificial Intelligence-based solution of its kind. In 1992, Madison Paper Company near Portland, Maine, United States, was the first to buy this solution and it used this solution until 2017 (i.e., for 25 years) until this company was sold to another company. 

During 1996-1997, Dr. Aggarwal was the director in the Strategy Department of IBM Research Division. In July 1997, IBM Research Division announced the formation of ‚ÄúIBM‚Äôs India Research Laboratory (IRL)‚Äù. Dr. Aggarwal ‚Äúfounded‚Äù IRL inside the IIT Delhi on January 1, 1998. By August 2000, he had grown it from "ground zero" to a 60-member team (with 30 PhDs and 30 Masters‚Äô in Computer Science and related areas).  

In January 2001, he co-founded Evalueserve (www.evalueserve.com), which currently has more than 4,000 employees and which provides various kinds of research and analytics services to clients in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. In 2003, along with his colleagues at Evalueserve, he pioneered the concept of ‚ÄúKnowledge Process Outsourcing (KPO)‚Äù and wrote the first article regarding KPO. 

In February 2014, Dr. Aggarwal founded Scry Analytics (now called Scry AI) that performs research and development (R&D) in Data Science and related areas. Scry AI (www.scryai.com) has four product groups that improve efficiency of business workflows regarding quality, timeliness, revenue, cost, customer experience, compliance, and operational risks. Scry AI's primary R&D center is located in San Jose, California, and three other centers are based in Gurgaon, Pune, and Hyderabad, India.  

In 2008, Dr. Aggarwal received Distinguished Alumnus Award from IIT Delhi. He has published 125 research articles, has been granted 8 patents from the US Patents and Trademark Office, and has been an editor of several academic journals in Computer Science. In December 2023, he published a book titled, ‚ÄúThe Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950-2050)", which is among the best seller list on Amazon.
prospects.headline: CEO and Chief Data Scientist at Scry AI | Author of the book, "The Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950-2050)"

prospects.name: Jeff Jonas
prospects.title: Founder & CEO
prospects.summary:
Jeff Jonas, founder and CEO of Senzing, is a data scientist and creator of Entity Resolution systems. For more than three decades, he has been at the forefront of solving complex big data problems for companies and governments. National Geographic recognized him as the Wizard of Big Data.  

Jonas sold his last company to IBM in 2005. Prior to founding Senzing, Jonas served as an IBM Fellow and Chief Scientist of Context Computing at IBM. He led a team focused on creating next-generation AI for Entity Resolution technology, code-named G2. At IBM G2 was deployed in many innovative ways, including modernizing U.S. voter registration through a joint effort with Pew Charitable Trust and helping the Singaporean government build a maritime domain awareness system to better protect the Malacca Straits. In 2016, Jonas founded Senzing, based on a one-of-a-kind IBM spinout of the G2 technology and team.

He regularly meets with government leaders, industry executives and think tanks around the globe about innovation, national security and privacy. Jonas serves on the boards of the United States Geospatial Intelligence Foundation (USGIF) and the Electronic Privacy Information Center (EPIC), and the advisory board of the Electronic Frontier Foundation (EFF). He is a Senior Associate at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS) and a Distinguished Engineer of Information Systems (adjunct) at Singapore Management University (SMU).

Jonas was awarded an honorary Ph.D. in Science in 2015 from Claremont Graduate University and is the author or co-author of 14 patents. His work has been featured in documentaries airing on networks such as the Discovery Channel, and he has been the subject of prominent chapters in books such as No Place to Hide, Safe: The Race to Protect Ourselves in a Newly Dangerous World, The Numerati and The Watchers: The Rise of America‚Äôs Surveillance State.
prospects.headline: Founder & CEO

prospects.name: Candyce. Edelen
prospects.title: Visibility builds trust‚Äîtrust drives revenue. Helping CxOs develop the executive credibility that attracts business and builds TRUST with your target audience. #Human2Human #NoBots | CEO | PropelGrowth
prospects.summary:
Your biggest competitor isn‚Äôt another firm. It‚Äôs your invisibility. 
If your target buyers don‚Äôt see you as a trusted authority early, you‚Äôll never even get considered.

Here‚Äôs what most leaders don‚Äôt realize: 90% of buyers build their shortlist before they even begin a formal buying process. If you‚Äôre not already on that list, getting added later is nearly impossible. 

And even if you do get added, most of the deals still go to the firms who influenced the buying vision from the very beginning. That‚Äôs the painful reality many companies don‚Äôt see until it‚Äôs too late.

If your firm is invisible to buyers before they start, you won‚Äôt even be considered. 

The leaders who show up early‚Äîsharing insights, shaping conversations, and establishing themselves as credible authorities‚Äîthey're the ones who make the list.

That‚Äôs why your individual executive voices matter. And that's why your presence on LinkedIn matters.

A faceless brand can‚Äôt build the same visibility or trust. People want to follow people, not just a logo.

The executives who understand this are seeing powerful results.

Gal Aga‚Äôs LinkedIn presence now drives 65% of his company‚Äôs leads.
Alina Vandenberghe says 50% of Chili Piper‚Äôs open opportunities are influenced by her posts‚Äîmillions in revenue every quarter.

Even leaders with modest followings are landing enterprise conversations, shortening sales cycles, and giving their teams the air cover they need to close bigger deals faster.

That‚Äôs the outcome I help leaders create. Not by turning you into an influencer, but by helping you become the trusted authority buyers recognize before they ever talk to sales.

Because when your leadership team is visible to your target audience, the whole company wins.

If you‚Äôd like to explore how visibility could change the game for your business, let‚Äôs connect.
prospects.headline: Visibility builds trust‚Äîtrust drives revenue. Helping CxOs develop the executive credibility that attracts business and builds TRUST with your target audience. #Human2Human #NoBots | CEO | PropelGrowth

prospects.name: Vladimir Ingerman
prospects.title: Founder and CEO @ AMROS Corporation | Geoscience Solutions Expert
prospects.summary:
Since 1994 Amros Corporation has been providing innovative geoscience solutions to help operators optimize the development of both conventional and unconventional reservoirs around the world.

In 2013, we introduced Shale Vision technology that separates bad and good zones in shale fields and optimizes the placement of horizontal wells. Developing only sweet spots allows operators to avoid drilling bad wells and focus on developing the highest producing wells with the potential for triple in production and recovery efficiency. This is a clean technology; an operator can save production and at the same time, pump much less water, proppants, and various chemicals under the ground.

Frac Less ‚Äì Produce More. 

More details in a 6-minute video https://youtu.be/gbKxCEsZ9_c

The technology could be easily tested using vertical wells with standard open-hole log data. A pilot project for these areas will identify reserves previously missed. We will generate locations of sweet spots, the best entry points and trajectories for horizontal wells. After this operator will have more confidence to use Shale Vision for developing new areas.

Shale Vision technology received five Awards at international technology events during 2015 ‚Äì 2021:

‚Ä¢	2021 Go Global Awards for a Frontrunner Award Professional Services in the category Energy. 
‚Ä¢	Finalist 2019 InnoSTARS Competition hosted by the US - China Innovation and Investment Summit. 
‚Ä¢	The Global Petroleum Show 2018 Award Winner in the category Innovations in Technologies. 
‚Ä¢	Finalist in the category New Horizons Idea in The World Oil Awards 2016.
‚Ä¢	Rice Alliance Energy 2015 Award Winner in the category Energy and Clean Technology.

Dr. Ingerman received a Doctor of Technical Science, as well as a Ph.D. in oil field development, and a Master of Science in geophysical methods. He has 55 professional publications, including two books. He has advised Schlumberger, Halliburton, Amoco, Shell, El Paso, and others in the United States. Internationally, he has advised all major Russian oil companies, most major oil firms in South America, Maersk Oil in Denmark, and ONGC in India. 

He has visited 74 countries, swam in 55 seas and oceans, and participated in a yacht trip around the world.
prospects.headline: Founder and CEO @ AMROS Corporation | Geoscience Solutions Expert

I am a London IT thought leader, entrepreneur and cybersecurity expert. I am an Entrepreneur's Organisation London member and was nominated for the prestigious UKTech50 award in 2022. 
 
I hold several IT qualifications including various Microsoft, Checkpoint and VMware certifications. Combined with my 20-plus years of experience in IT, and management qualifications from the London School of Business & Finance and Cranfield School of Management, I appreciate that IT drives growth but also has security risks.
 
In 2006, I founded Zhero, a London-headquartered end-to-end cybersecurity and IT support company for SMEs. Zhero is a Microsoft Gold partner providing bespoke risk mitigation, cybersecurity, cloud, IT support, consultancy, and professional services to the medical, finance, legal, insurance, and architecture sectors and others. Zhero has worked with brilliant minds and institutions such as WeWork, Giorgio Armani, Energy UK, the Federation of Master Builders, City, University of London and Dimension Data.
 
In November 2023, I published my latest Amazon best-seller, You Don‚Äôt Need a ¬£1 Million Cybersecurity Budget. The book shows how SMEs can affordably enhance cybersecurity resilience and cyber hygiene. It peaked at number one in the UK and the US, making me an international best-selling author. I have previously co-authored two best-selling IT books, ‚ÄòAdapt and Overcome‚Äô and ‚ÄòCybersecurity NOW‚Äô, available on Amazon. These are essential reads for navigating the worlds of cybersecurity, remote working, and the digitised workplace. My insights have also been featured in The Economist, UK Computer Weekly and other prominent publications.

In January 2024, I co-founded Cyber London and others and am also a director. Cyber London is recognised by the Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT) and the UK Cyber Cluster Collaboration (UKC3) as the official Cyber Cluster for London, an informal network of people and organisations who work in or have an interest in cybersecurity. 

I‚Äôve been a keynote speaker at events hosted by The Economist, N-Able, and London Market Forums (LMF). At the LMF 2023 Cyber Resilience Leaders‚Äô Summit, I shared cutting-edge cybersecurity and risk mitigation strategies with contemporary pioneers such as Gary Brailsford-Hart, Director of Information & CISO at City of London Police, and Simon Newman, CEO of the Cyber Resilience Centre for London. In collaboration with City, University of London, I have also had the privilege to represent the UK at round table events hosted by the Australian High Commission.

prospects.name: Alok Aggarwal
prospects.title: CEO and Chief Data Scientist at Scry AI | Author of the book, "The Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950-2050)"
prospects.summary:
Dr. Alok Aggarwal received his B. Tech. from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Delhi in 1980 and his Ph. D. in 1984 from Johns Hopkins University in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science. He worked at IBM‚Äôs T. J. Watson Research Center in New York during 1984 and 2000. During 1988-89, he took a sabbatical from IBM and to teach two courses and supervise two Ph.D. students at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT). 

During 1992 and 1995, along with others, he built and sold a "Supply Chain Management Solution" for paper mills and steel mills, which was the first commercial Artificial Intelligence-based solution of its kind. In 1992, Madison Paper Company near Portland, Maine, United States, was the first to buy this solution and it used this solution until 2017 (i.e., for 25 years) until this company was sold to another company. 

During 1996-1997, Dr. Aggarwal was the director in the Strategy Department of IBM Research Division. In July 1997, IBM Research Division announced the formation of ‚ÄúIBM‚Äôs India Research Laboratory (IRL)‚Äù. Dr. Aggarwal ‚Äúfounded‚Äù IRL inside the IIT Delhi on January 1, 1998. By August 2000, he had grown it from "ground zero" to a 60-member team (with 30 PhDs and 30 Masters‚Äô in Computer Science and related areas).  

In January 2001, he co-founded Evalueserve (www.evalueserve.com), which currently has more than 4,000 employees and which provides various kinds of research and analytics services to clients in North America, Europe, and Asia Pacific. In 2003, along with his colleagues at Evalueserve, he pioneered the concept of ‚ÄúKnowledge Process Outsourcing (KPO)‚Äù and wrote the first article regarding KPO. 

In February 2014, Dr. Aggarwal founded Scry Analytics (now called Scry AI) that performs research and development (R&D) in Data Science and related areas. Scry AI (www.scryai.com) has four product groups that improve efficiency of business workflows regarding quality, timeliness, revenue, cost, customer experience, compliance, and operational risks. Scry AI's primary R&D center is located in San Jose, California, and three other centers are based in Gurgaon, Pune, and Hyderabad, India.  

In 2008, Dr. Aggarwal received Distinguished Alumnus Award from IIT Delhi. He has published 125 research articles, has been granted 8 patents from the US Patents and Trademark Office, and has been an editor of several academic journals in Computer Science. In December 2023, he published a book titled, ‚ÄúThe Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950-2050)", which is among the best seller list on Amazon.
prospects.headline: CEO and Chief Data Scientist at Scry AI | Author of the book, "The Fourth Industrial Revolution and 100 Years of AI (1950-2050)"

prospects.name: Addison Morris
prospects.title: Founder & CEO at Women's Cannabis Chamber of Commerce
prospects.summary:
I am a serial entrepreneur with more than 50 years of experience developing, launching, and marketing businesses. Coming from a long line of entrepreneurs, I have always focused on identifying market niches, anticipating economic trends, and adapting to evolving consumer demands.

Over the past five decades, I have launched seven successful businesses, gained valuable lessons from one that failed, and strategically chose not to pursue two others after recognizing their lack of viability.
Before entering the cannabis industry, I founded Panache Press, a social media marketing and business development company. There, I worked with 28 entrepreneurs, providing strategic planning, market research, financing guidance, and marketing strategies that helped them successfully launch and grow their businesses.

As an equal rights activist in Colorado, I became deeply involved in the movement to legalize adult-use cannabis. Recognizing the enormous opportunities legalization would create, I rebranded Panache Press as Sweet Jane Marketing, one of the first agencies dedicated to the cannabis industry.

In 2016, I launched the Women‚Äôs Cannabis Chamber of Commerce (WCCC) to provide entrepreneurs with essential business, cannabis, and marketing education. Since its founding, the Chamber has continued to evolve, expanding membership benefits to meet the needs of a rapidly changing industry.

 üëâ Learn more: womenscannabischamberofcommerce.com/membership

With over 15 years of experience developing and teaching cannabis business and marketing strategies, I am now returning to my roots‚Äîbusiness development and strategic planning‚Äîworking directly with entrepreneurs to build sustainable, successful companies in this rapidly evolving industry.
Through the Women‚Äôs Cannabis Chamber of Commerce, I have cultivated relationships with accomplished cannabis business owners across every sector. Their expertise and insights enhance our ability to design comprehensive Business Development Plans tailored to each client‚Äôs vision and goals.

Our Business Development Plans encompass:

Business Strategy

Market Research

Competitive Analysis

Marketing Strategy

Brand Book

Sales Strategy

Financial Projections

Additionally, we offer Operational Plans (SOPs) and Compliance Plans as needed.

Addison Morris & Co. officially launches January 1, 2026.

For more information contact: addison@womenscannabischamberofcommerce.com

prospects.name: Mark Zafra
prospects.title: Chief of Procurement, Non-Profit Board Member, Start-Up Advisor, Builder, Global Adventurer
prospects.summary:
Mark Zafra leads the Source to Pay Function (CPO) at LiveRamp (LiveRamp is the data collaboration platform trusted by forward-looking global companies to connect customer data from anywhere to everywhere).  He manages global strategic sourcing, purchasing, travel and accounts payable.  He has more than twenty years of sourcing and supply chain experience driving innovation and change in operations, business transformation, information technology, and management. Mr Zafra is successful at mentoring diverse teams to achieve extraordinary business results.  

His prior role was Twitter‚Äôs Head of Global Strategic Sourcing, leading the enterprise-wide sourcing transformation for all expenditures at Twitter, Inc..  Mr. Zafra joined Twitter in 2015 after serving as Chief Procurement Officer for Allianz Fireman‚Äôs Fund Insurance Company. There, he oversaw sourcing responsibility for all supplier spend. Prior to that role, Mr. Zafra led the Strategic Sourcing for Technology at McKesson, a Fortune 10 company. He also led global teams in supply chain (direct procurement) of technologies and services at HP, Agilent Technologies, Verigy, and Bookham Technology.¬† 

Mr. Zafra is active in San Francisco‚Äôs nonprofit community, and was recently on the Board of Directors for the Edgewood Center for Children and Families for six years. He previously was on the Boards for the Leukemia Society of Greater San Francisco, GiveADayGlobal, and EachOne/ReachOne and currently volunteers with AIDS Lifecycle and American Cancer Society. Additionally, Mr. Zafra served two years in the Peace Corps in Southeast Asia.¬† 

Mr. Zafra holds an MBA in Supply Chain from Arizona State, a Masters of International Management (MIM) from Thunderbird School of Global Management, and a Bachelor of Arts degree from Trinity College. He has lived and worked in Asia, Europe and the Americas.

* Some of his non-profit volunteer work is featured in the Examiner: http://www.examiner.com/charity-in-san-jose/leukemia-lymphoma-society-announces-man-woman-of-the-year-fundraising-totals

* He was interviewed in the Wall Street Journal [http://www.wsj.com/articles/SB119997888066281005 ] describes his background in global supply chain operations management.
prospects.headline: Chief of Procurement, Non-Profit Board Member, Start-Up Advisor, Builder, Global Adventurer

prospects.summary:
Over 20 years of operations and general management experience, with the past 12 years in senior and executive leadership roles. I bring a global and uniquely rich perspective and expertise to executive leadership, having lived and worked as a U.S. Diplomat in five continents (Africa, Asia, Europe, North and South America), a U.S. Army Combat Veteran, and a Kellogg MBA graduate. 

LEADERSHIP STRENGTH HIGHLIGHTS

‚ñ™ Proven track in establishing vision and transforming them into action; setting strategic direction to mature operations across multiple lines of businesses; and bolstering change management and communication strategies.

Top 5 Gallup Clifton Strengths Themes:
‚ñ™ Restorative ‚ñ™ Strategic ‚ñ™ Activator ‚ñ™ Woo ‚ñ™ Communication 

**** Want to learn more about me? Please continue to read! ****

The first time I traveled, it wasn‚Äôt by choice. At 16, I was displaced by the civil war in Sierra Leone and became a refugee in Guinea‚Äîseparated from my parents and thrust into uncertainty. That experience, though difficult, shaped who I am. Now, as I travel the world by choice, I carry not only a deep appreciation for diverse cultures but also the resilience and adaptability forged in those early years.

My experiences‚Äîas a U.S. Diplomat, military veteran, and Kellogg MBA‚Äîfuel my passion for learning and sharpen my ability to lead global operations and drive P&L growth. I believe in people-first leadership grounded in emotional intelligence, cultural awareness, and a commitment to customers and communities. Recognized as a visionary, I specialize in talent development, inspiring teams, and implementing scalable solutions that deliver sustainable impact.

I‚Äôm well-positioned to serve as Chief Operating Officer or General Manager, having led cross-functional teams of 400+ across multiple business units, including:

My R&D background allows me to analyse the advantages of one technology over another. At Cybernetica, we draw on multiple synergies to deliver effective, safe and secure solutions. While I started with a local focus, today I am also responsible for helping build our international capabilities. 

As somewhat of a talking head for our work here, I am comfortable speaking to big crowds or making presentations. Regularly published and active on Twitter and LinkedIn, I‚Äôm the guy who gets to present all the cool new stuff we are developing. From my experience, I can simply explain how other countries are handling cybersecurity and data privacy issues. 

At Cybernetica, we are constantly learning and improving upon what other companies are doing in our field. Creating a tech surprise for our competitors is what I live for. Thanks to our technical and cultural advantage, we are able to do things differently. 

Key partners in the creation of e-Estonia, we have a deep and practical experience in understanding the power of data along with the importance of individual and corporate privacy, governmental data security and integrity. Working closely with our clients, we can confidently provide a team of specialist professionals with a track record of robust and resilient solutions.  

I want people to pick up on the ideas we are working on, realise their importance and raise awareness of the new digital world, which is growing at an exponential rate, and with it, the risks. Am a big believer in the importance of education. I  lecture for Master‚Äôs and PhD students. There is currently a huge lack of awareness about the control of identity and data. That is something I wish to remedy.

content:
Awesome! Let's dive in.

First things first ‚Äî what's your name, and what do you do? I'd love to know your role and a bit about your company (if you're cool sharing that).
#override

Also, just so I can help you properly: are you looking to scrape LinkedIn to find prospects that match a specific profile, or is this more about pulling data for another reason? Want to make sure I point you in the right direction.
hey sam
find me startup ceos of your connection thorsten linz in california

Hey! I'm Sam.

I'm part of a team of AI agents that handle your entire GTM process ‚Äî building campaigns, following up with prospects, all the tedious stuff.

My job? Get to know your business through conversation. I'll ask you about 20-30 questions to really nail down your ideal customer. You answer naturally, and that powers everything else.

Takes about 25 minutes today. After that, you can generate campaigns in 60 seconds whenever you need them.

Sound interesting?
#override
#override

Got it ‚Äî override mode activated.

What would you like me to do differently? I'm all ears.
need to test the data approval system
#override

I don't actually have direct access to check your Settings right now, but let's keep moving ‚Äî we can always fall back to Bright Data if needed.

Tell me about your ideal prospect: What job titles, industries, company sizes, or locations should I be searching for? The more specific, the better the results.
can you find me 20 CEOs at tech startups

Hey!

I'd love to help you find those 20 CEOs at tech startups. Head over to the **Data Approval** tab (left sidebar) and enter your search criteria there. Results will populate in real-time - should take about 10-15 seconds for 20 prospects.

While you're doing that, quick question: Have we chatted before? I want to make sure I'm giving you the best results possible, and knowing a bit about what you're looking for helps me dial in the search.

Perfect, let's test the data approval flow.

To trigger it properly, I'll need some context first ‚Äî are we testing ICP approval, prospect list approval, or messaging approval? Or do you want me to just mock up a full approval scenario so we can see how the system handles it end-to-end?
prospect list. need to test linkedin data retrieval first. need 20 of my first degree connections from claifornia who work in marketing
